editorialSummary.text: A long-running lesbian hangout for drinks, shooting pool & dancing, especially on weekends.

originalText.text: Loveeee this bar!!! First time going , went for a Taylor Swift night and they ate that !!! Super fun atmosphere and awesome bartenders. I recommend the Apple-Cran Mule. Favorite lesbian bar by far ü§©ü§©‚ú®

originalText.text: We visited early December 2023 on a Saturday night and the bar was awesome! It was packed but we were able to dance with no problem. The music was good, they played all kinds of music from pop to R&B, reggaeton, etc. Beers are cheap and people are nice üëçüèª def coming back!

originalText.text: Cute bar! Went out for a last minute birthday celebration, and it was a great time. The staff and bartenders were THE NICEST, which was great. The space is a little small, but it‚Äôs still fun to dance wherever you can find a spot. The music selection seemed obscure with some tiktok hits thrown into the mix, but we had a great time. I‚Äôd recommend it for anyone looking for a chill night out!

originalText.text:
**They are racist. My Black friend was pushed by a white man here, and Henrietta kicked out my friend, banned her indefinitely, and kept (stole) her ID ‚Äî¬†all of which feels illegal.

I edited my former review when I found out about the above incident, but honestly, it makes sense, because Henrietta's owner and a manager were also racist and misogynist to me (I'm 1/2 MENA & highly feminine, both identities that were not well-received by the owner & manager).

Nonetheless - as my earlier review stated - I have lots of fun whenever I go here. All the bartenders are REALLY cool and sweet.

Would have been 5 stars, but I took off 2 for the above reasons. Henrietta's owner/manager should stop upholding societal misogyny in which men are valued more than women. Isn't this a lesbian space?

originalText.text: I had not been here in years. A friend came in from California and wanted to check it out, so we went. The staff at the door was nice but the bartender at the main bar was rude. She didn‚Äôt know how to make a common drink that my friend asked for. When she googled the drink, she then said that she could not make it. Fine, we switched up the drink. After serving us several times, I go and ask her for the same 2 drinks we had been ordering all night. She gave me mine but refused to make my friends drink with no explanation. Her entire attitude would shift, whenever my friend ordered drinks. Too bad that they don‚Äôt hire the type of bartenders they used to hire in the past, who were always friendly.
